title: Life in the OC(e)
body:
My life:

>>winning ranked, promotion series game. score of 20 -5
>>DC
>>client wont let me reconnect (for second time in past week*)
>>Restart client, as this helps when unable to reconnect.
>> PATCH. some time since i started playing, a patch was released.
>> My team won (4v5) before i could return.
>>> 'Leave'
>>> Low priority Que (FOR EVERYTHING) [that's a 5 minute wait that overrides the entire client. want to browse the shop? wait another 5 minutes.)
>>> Lose promotion series. 

all because the client cant seem to connect to games without being babied through steps. It is it's primary function? too bad. 

Top kek oce. 

I understand nothing can be done(?) i simply must live in this system that 'works just fine'

replies.body:
any reason, to your knowledge as to why i must restart the client every time i DC, even for 1 second?

>'attempting to reconnect' (sempiternal message)
> close game.
> attempt to reconnect with client
> black screen
> close LoL all together.
> re-launch
> works fine.
Not looking for trolls. Just rectification to clear up my ignorance.

Here's a theory: That might be caused by *something* terminating your connection while it's already been long established, and yet it's not affecting new ones. When you reconnect to a game without completely closing your client, the same game address is used to reconnect. If that *something* is blocking that specific address, then it would bring you to the black screen (or give you a firewall error, though it might not be occuring because the dialogue is not being triggered because *some* connections are actually still working). I'm thinking either a bad connection (though it wouldn't explain the consistency of it), a crappy ISP with misconfigured servers, malicious software on your computer or your bandwidth just being entirely used up at one point. If it's the last, then your client would get a ping of zero data (if even for the briefest of moments) and that could be causing it to choke up until it's re-established.

Just a theory. I'm by no means a professional on networking.

Oh hey, have you tried disabling IPv6? That could be causing this.
I'll investigate your points further. Thank you.

Hm.

It's just a game, I guess. And nothing's perfect.

Maybe consider getting a job in the game industry, becoming well experienced enough until you're eventually hired by Riot Games and fix the client yourself?
No need to guess, we are in fact discussing a game.
I wonder if Riot will accept commissions...
